title: Die Lun√¶, 28 Junii, 1647. Resolved, &c. that it be referred to the commissioners with the army to be very earnest with the general, that effectuall course may be taken, ...
author: England and Wales. Parliament. House of Commons.
publisher: Printed by Richard Cotes and Ruth Raworth,
notes: No discouragement or obstruction is to be offered to the collection of payments for Parliament.  -- Cf. Steele.
Includes: An order of his Excellencie Sir Tho. Fairfax, General of the Forces raised by the Parliament, in pursuance of the order aforesaid. Dated: Wickham, the first day of July, 1647.
Signed: Hen. Elsynge Cler. Parl. Dom. Com.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
